name: Slow Cooker Root Beer Pulled Pork
author: Emily.cimino
summary: This simple slow cooker pulled pork recipe is big hit with my family of picky eaters. For a spicy kick, mix 1 part Frank's® RedHot® Buffalo sauce and 1 part of your favorite mustard-based BBQ sauce. You can use a pork loin instead of pork shoulder, if desired. Combine with your favorite BBQ sauce and enjoy.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons coarse kosher salt, or to taste
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle root beer
1 (4 fluid ounce) bottle liquid smoke flavoring, or to taste
directions: Place pork roast in a slow cooker, rub with salt, and pour root beer, liquid smoke, and garlic over the top
Cook on Low for 8 to 10 hours
Strain liquid through a fine-mesh strainer; discard liquid or save for another use (see Editor's Note)
Add garlic cloves back to to pork
Serve with your favorite BBQ sauce
